intro: Melachne, commonly known as the "bittergrass," is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are annual or perennial herbs native to Africa, Asia, and Australia. The plants typically have narrow, grass-like leaves and produce small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikes. Melachne species are often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. Their botanical features make them adaptable to various ecological conditions, though they are not widely cultivated for agricultural purposes.
